channel.title: Dice game
channel.description:
Hello, for my computer science class in my senior of high school, I need to make a dice game that rolls 2 sets five dice. It needs to compare the 2 sets and if theres two of a kind, three of a kind, etc. Whatever set has the highest of a kind wins.
I have no idea how to handle this. PLS HELP.
What I tried:
array to hold 6 values. then a for loop and if (roll[i] == 1) count[1]++
didnt work

item.title: Dice game
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You have a problem with the count variable. You’ve set the size of the array to 5, but you’re using 6 indexes:

	private int[] count = new int[5];// only 5

else if (dice[random] == 6) { count[5]++;// 6th index }
This can cause an exception every time you run it.
Other than that, I ran the code a couple of times and it didn’t “always print 0”.

Read full topic

item.title: Dice game
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

ok so i’m not using her code. But I’m stuck. I’m trying to roll all the nice with a for loop. but the print method all prints 0. dafuq is wrong.

[code=java]
public class Dice {

private int[] dice;

private int[] count = new int[5];


public Dice(int amount) {
	this.dice = new int[amount];
}


public void roll() 
{
	for (int i = 0; i < dice.length; i++) {
		int random = ((int)(Math.random() * 6) + 1);
		
		dice[i] = random;
		if (dice[random] == 1) {
			count[0]++;
		}
		else if (dice[random] == 2) {
			count[1]++;
		}
		else if (dice[random] == 3) {
			count[2]++;
		}
		else if (dice[random] == 4) {
			count[3]++;
		}
		else if (dice[random] == 5) {
			count[4]++;
		}
		else if (dice[random] == 6) {
			count[5]++;
		}
	}
}



public void findMatch() {
	System.out.println(count[0]);
	System.out.println(count[1]);
	System.out.println(count[2]);
	System.out.println(count[3]);
	System.out.println(count[4]);
	
}

}[/code]

Read full topic

If it looks too good to be true for your skill level (which this thread leads me to believe it is), you also run the risk of being searched for cheating if you submit that above code.[/quote]
I’m not using all of it, I just needed an example on how to count three of a kind in dice etc. I wrote the first by myself. I’ll upload it in a bit when i’m home.

item.title: Dice game
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:11, topic:554028”]This would only check 2 of a kind or 3 of a kind ect it would not check two pairs or full house

Game[0] Player A won with with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[2][2][2][4][6] PLAYER B: [2][4][4][5][6]
Game[1] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[1][2][3][6][6] PLAYER B: [2][3][4][5][5]
Game[2] Player A won with with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[1][5][6][6][6] PLAYER B: [1][2][3][4][6]
Game[3] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[1][1][3][3][6] PLAYER B: [1][2][5][5][6]
Game[4] Player A won with with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[2][2][2][5][5] PLAYER B: [1][2][3][5][6]
Game[5] Player A won with with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[2][2][2][3][6] PLAYER B: [1][3][3][5][5]
Game[6] Player A won with with 2 of a kind PLAYER A:[1][3][3][4][4] PLAYER B: [1][3][4][5][6]
Game[7] Player B won with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[1][2][2][4][6] PLAYER B: [4][4][5][5][5]
Game[8] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[1][1][2][6][6] PLAYER B: [2][4][5][5][6]
Game[9] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[2][2][3][5][6] PLAYER B: [1][3][3][4][4]
Game[10] Player B won with 4 of a kind PLAYER A:[1][3][4][4][6] PLAYER B: [1][6][6][6][6]
Game[11] Player A won with with 2 of a kind PLAYER A:[1][2][2][3][3] PLAYER B: [1][2][3][5][6]
Game[12] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[2][2][4][4][6] PLAYER B: [3][4][4][5][6]
Game[13] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[2][3][4][4][6] PLAYER B: [1][1][3][3][6]
Game[14] Player A won with with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[1][1][5][5][5] PLAYER B: [2][3][4][4][6]
Game[15] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[1][2][2][4][5] PLAYER B: [1][4][4][5][5]
Game[16] Player B won with 2 of a kind PLAYER A:[1][2][3][5][6] PLAYER B: [1][1][3][6][6]
Game[17] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[1][2][3][3][4] PLAYER B: [3][4][4][5][6]
Game[18] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[4][4][5][6][6] PLAYER B: [1][1][2][4][5]
Game[19] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[1][1][2][5][6] PLAYER B: [1][2][3][3][5]
Game[20] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[1][1][2][4][4] PLAYER B: [1][2][2][3][6]
Game[21] Player A won with with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[2][3][3][3][6] PLAYER B: [2][2][5][5][6]
Game[22] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[1][1][3][3][6] PLAYER B: [1][1][3][5][6]
Game[23] Player B won with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[2][3][4][4][5] PLAYER B: [2][3][3][3][6]
Game[24] Player B won with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[1][2][4][5][6] PLAYER B: [3][3][3][5][5]

[code=java]

import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Arrays;
import java.util.LinkedList;
import java.util.concurrent.ThreadLocalRandom;

/**
*

  • @author Silabsoft
    */
    public class DiceGame {

    private final Player playerA;
    private final Player playerB;
    private int gameId = 0;
    private static final int NUMBER_OF_DICE = 5;

    public DiceGame() {
    playerA = new Player();
    playerB = new Player();
    }

    public static void main(String args[]) {
    DiceGame game = new DiceGame();
    for (int i = 0; i < 25; i++) { //play 25 games
    game.rollDice();
    game.findAndDelcareWinner();
    }
    }

    private void rollDice() {
    int[] playerARoll = new int[NUMBER_OF_DICE];
    int[] playerBRoll = new int[NUMBER_OF_DICE];
    for (int i = 0; i < NUMBER_OF_DICE; i++) {
    playerARoll[i] = ThreadLocalRandom.current().nextInt(1, 6 + 1);
    playerBRoll[i] = ThreadLocalRandom.current().nextInt(1, 6 + 1);
    }
    playerA.getRollResults().add(gameId, playerARoll);
    playerB.getRollResults().add(gameId, playerBRoll);
    }

    private void findAndDelcareWinner() {
    int playerAKindCount = getKindCount(playerA.getRollResults().get(gameId));
    int playerBKindCount = getKindCount(playerB.getRollResults().get(gameId));
    String winner = “Game[” + gameId + "] ";
    if (playerAKindCount == playerBKindCount) {
    winner += "Resulted in a tie ";
    } else {
    winner += playerAKindCount > playerBKindCount ? "Player A won with with " + playerAKindCount : "Player B won with " + playerBKindCount;
    winner += " of a kind ";
    }
    winner += “PLAYER A:” + playerA.rollToString(gameId) + " PLAYER B: " + playerB.rollToString(gameId);

     System.out.println(winner);
 gameId++;

    }

    private int getKindCount(int[] roll) {
    Arrays.sort(roll);
    int lastValue = 0;
    int largestCount = 1;
    int currentCount = 1;
    for (int i = 0; i < roll.length; i++) {
    if (i > 0) {
    if (roll[i] == lastValue) {
    currentCount++;
    } else {
    if (largestCount < currentCount) {
    largestCount = currentCount;
    }
    currentCount = 1;
    }
    }
    lastValue = roll[i];
    }
    if (currentCount > largestCount) {
    return currentCount;
    } else {
    return largestCount;
    }
    }

    private class Player {

     private final LinkedList<int[]> rollResults;

 public Player() {
     this.rollResults = new LinkedList<int[]>();
 }

 public LinkedList<int[]> getRollResults() {
     return rollResults;
 }

 public String rollToString(int gameId) {
     String rollString = "";
     int[] roll = rollResults.get(gameId);
     for (int i = 0; i < roll.length; i++) {
         rollString += "[" + roll[i] + "]";
     }
     return rollString;
 }

    }
    }

[/code][/quote]

Exactly what I needed, thank you so much.

Read full topic

item.title: Dice game
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

This would only check 2 of a kind or 3 of a kind ect it would not check two pairs or full house

Game[0] Player A won with with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[2][2][2][4][6] PLAYER B: [2][4][4][5][6] Game[1] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[1][2][3][6][6] PLAYER B: [2][3][4][5][5] Game[2] Player A won with with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[1][5][6][6][6] PLAYER B: [1][2][3][4][6] Game[3] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[1][1][3][3][6] PLAYER B: [1][2][5][5][6] Game[4] Player A won with with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[2][2][2][5][5] PLAYER B: [1][2][3][5][6] Game[5] Player A won with with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[2][2][2][3][6] PLAYER B: [1][3][3][5][5] Game[6] Player A won with with 2 of a kind PLAYER A:[1][3][3][4][4] PLAYER B: [1][3][4][5][6] Game[7] Player B won with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[1][2][2][4][6] PLAYER B: [4][4][5][5][5] Game[8] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[1][1][2][6][6] PLAYER B: [2][4][5][5][6] Game[9] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[2][2][3][5][6] PLAYER B: [1][3][3][4][4] Game[10] Player B won with 4 of a kind PLAYER A:[1][3][4][4][6] PLAYER B: [1][6][6][6][6] Game[11] Player A won with with 2 of a kind PLAYER A:[1][2][2][3][3] PLAYER B: [1][2][3][5][6] Game[12] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[2][2][4][4][6] PLAYER B: [3][4][4][5][6] Game[13] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[2][3][4][4][6] PLAYER B: [1][1][3][3][6] Game[14] Player A won with with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[1][1][5][5][5] PLAYER B: [2][3][4][4][6] Game[15] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[1][2][2][4][5] PLAYER B: [1][4][4][5][5] Game[16] Player B won with 2 of a kind PLAYER A:[1][2][3][5][6] PLAYER B: [1][1][3][6][6] Game[17] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[1][2][3][3][4] PLAYER B: [3][4][4][5][6] Game[18] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[4][4][5][6][6] PLAYER B: [1][1][2][4][5] Game[19] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[1][1][2][5][6] PLAYER B: [1][2][3][3][5] Game[20] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[1][1][2][4][4] PLAYER B: [1][2][2][3][6] Game[21] Player A won with with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[2][3][3][3][6] PLAYER B: [2][2][5][5][6] Game[22] Resulted in a tie PLAYER A:[1][1][3][3][6] PLAYER B: [1][1][3][5][6] Game[23] Player B won with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[2][3][4][4][5] PLAYER B: [2][3][3][3][6] Game[24] Player B won with 3 of a kind PLAYER A:[1][2][4][5][6] PLAYER B: [3][3][3][5][5]

import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Arrays;
import java.util.LinkedList;
import java.util.concurrent.ThreadLocalRandom;

/**
 *
 * @author Silabsoft
 */
public class DiceGame {

    private final Player playerA;
    private final Player playerB;
    private int gameId = 0;
    private static final int NUMBER_OF_DICE = 5;

    public DiceGame() {
        playerA = new Player();
        playerB = new Player();
    }

    public static void main(String args[]) {
        DiceGame game = new DiceGame();
        for (int i = 0; i < 25; i++) { //play 25 games
            game.rollDice();
            game.findAndDelcareWinner();
        }
    }

    private void rollDice() {
        int[] playerARoll = new int[NUMBER_OF_DICE];
        int[] playerBRoll = new int[NUMBER_OF_DICE];
        for (int i = 0; i < NUMBER_OF_DICE; i++) {
            playerARoll[i] = ThreadLocalRandom.current().nextInt(1, 6 + 1);
            playerBRoll[i] = ThreadLocalRandom.current().nextInt(1, 6 + 1);
        }
        playerA.getRollResults().add(gameId, playerARoll);
        playerB.getRollResults().add(gameId, playerBRoll);
    }

    private void findAndDelcareWinner() {
        int playerAKindCount = getKindCount(playerA.getRollResults().get(gameId));
        int playerBKindCount = getKindCount(playerB.getRollResults().get(gameId));
        String winner = "Game[" + gameId + "]  ";
        if (playerAKindCount == playerBKindCount) {
            winner += "Resulted in a tie ";
        } else {
            winner += playerAKindCount > playerBKindCount ? "Player A won with with " + playerAKindCount : "Player B won with " + playerBKindCount;
            winner += " of a kind ";
        }
        winner += "PLAYER A:" + playerA.rollToString(gameId) + " PLAYER B: " + playerB.rollToString(gameId);

        System.out.println(winner);
        gameId++;
    }

    private int getKindCount(int[] roll) {
        Arrays.sort(roll);
        int lastValue = 0;
        int largestCount = 1;
        int currentCount = 1;
        for (int i = 0; i < roll.length; i++) {
            if (i > 0) {
                if (roll[i] == lastValue) {
                    currentCount++;
                } else {
                    if (largestCount < currentCount) {
                        largestCount = currentCount;
                    }
                    currentCount = 1;
                }
            }
            lastValue = roll[i];
        }
        if (currentCount > largestCount) {
            return currentCount;
        } else {
            return largestCount;
        }
    }

    private class Player {

        private final LinkedList<int[]> rollResults;

        public Player() {
            this.rollResults = new LinkedList<int[]>();
        }

        public LinkedList<int[]> getRollResults() {
            return rollResults;
        }

        public String rollToString(int gameId) {
            String rollString = "";
            int[] roll = rollResults.get(gameId);
            for (int i = 0; i < roll.length; i++) {
                rollString += "[" + roll[i] + "]";
            }
            return rollString;
        }
    }
}

item.title: Dice game
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

Okay, how about this? [code=java]public class DiceGame {
public static void main(String[] args) {
int[] first_set = new int[]{ 1, 4, 5 };
int[] second_set = new int[]{ 1, 4, 5 };
int[] intersection = new int[3];

    for(int i = 0; i < first_set.length; i++) {
        for(int j = 0; j < first_set.length; j++) {
            if(first_set[i] == second_set[j])
                intersection[i] = first_set[i];
        }
    }

    int count = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < intersection.length; i++) {
        if(intersection[i] != 0) count++;
    }

    System.out.println(count+" of a kind");
}

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Dice game
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

[quote=“z, post:8, topic:554028”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=672951.msg4500138#msg4500138 date=1449439945]

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=672951.msg4500135#msg4500135 date=1449439413] int[] otherSet = { 6, 2, 5, 5, 2 };[/quote]
This isn’t a set.

Yeah ignore the naming.
I was naming them based on "set of dice"
So, one “set” of dice, and the “otherSet” of dice.
[/quote]Ah, now that’s a set. The distinct dice themselves. Here’s my attempt, using retainAll (which is intersection in the Set class):

[code=java]import java.util.HashSet;
import java.util.Set;

public class DiceGame {
public static void main(String[] args) {
Set first_set = new HashSet() {{
add(1); add(4); add(5);
}};

    Set<Integer> second_set = new HashSet<Integer>() {{
        add(1); add(4); add(5);
    }};

    first_set.retainAll(second_set); // retains only the elements in first_set that are contained in second_set, i.e. the intersection of the two sets

    System.out.println(first_set.size() + " of a kind");
}

}[/code]

Also, there are 6 choose 3 combinations for each set (6 die, pick 3): {1,2,3}, {1,2,4}, {1,2,5}, {1,2,6}, {1,3,4}, {1,3,5}, {1,3,6}, {1,4,5}, {1,4,6}, {1,5,6}, {2,3,4}, {2,3,5}, {2,3,6}, {2,4,5}, {2,4,6}, {2,5,6}, {3,4,5}, {3,4,6}, {3,5,6}, {4,5,6}[/quote]

Thank you but that’s way too advanced to show my teacher.

Read full topic

item.title: Dice game
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

kronikz:

I know that part, the part I don’t understand is finding out if theres a “three of a kind” etc. I know how to compare the results its just the find how many rolled the same is my problem.

I think you could accomplish that by using two for loops.
You loop through the values of the first array, and compare the current value of the loop against the other array. You use a second loop to compare the single value from the first array and add to an int for each match found.
An example is below.

[code=java]public class DiceTest {

public static void main(String[] args) {
	int[] set = { 3, 1, 5, 2, 4 };
	int[] otherSet = { 6, 2, 5, 5, 2 };

	System.out.println("Matches found: ");
	for (int i : set)
		checkMatches(i, otherSet);
}

public static void checkMatches(int value, int[] setTwo) {
	int matched = 0;
	for (int i : setTwo) {
		if (i == value)
			matched++;
	}
	System.out.println("Found " + matched + " matches for " + value);
}

}[/code]

Output:

Matches found: Found 0 matches for 3 Found 0 matches for 1 Found 2 matches for 5 Found 2 matches for 2 Found 0 matches for 4

Of course, you’d want to tweak it to what the assignment is.

Read full topic

item.title: Dice game
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

You should intersect the two sets and count the intersection size. If two sets intersect on N elements, then there is N of a kind.

Read full topic

item.title: Dice game
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Now, I’m probably thinking of this rather terrible…
But couldn’t you create a “Dice” object, that would create an array of integers for how many dice would be used:

[code=java]public class Dice {

 private int[] dice;

 public Dice(int amount) {
      this.dice = new int[amount];
 }[/code]

Then you just have to make two of them:

private Dice firstSet = new Dice(5); private Dice secondSet = new Dice(5);

From there… You’d have to roll the dice, set their values (You’d need a getter/setter in the Dice object).
Then compare the sets, and print the results.

That’s what I’d think of when doing this… but there’s probably a better solution.

Read full topic

item.title: Dice game
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

Hello, for my computer science class in my senior of high school, I need to make a dice game that rolls 2 sets five dice. It needs to compare the 2 sets and if theres two of a kind, three of a kind, etc. Whatever set has the highest of a kind wins.

I have no idea how to handle this. PLS HELP.

What I tried:

array to hold 6 values. then a for loop and if (roll[i] == 1) count[1]++

didnt work

Read full topic
